channel.title: Debian Installer (`D-I`)
channel.description:
Thanks to @arraybolt3 in the next release of Kicksecure 17.2.3.9 and above, it will be possible to use D-I ([Debian-Installer - Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debian-Installer), the “console looking” Debian installer) (not calamares!).
references:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debian-Installer
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preseed * https://wiki.debian.org/DebianInstaller * https://wiki.debian.org/DebianInstaller/FAQ * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preseed
What this is **not**? **This is not calamares.**
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calamares_(software)
----
D-I is somewhat a "by-product" of switching to build the ISO using Debian live-build (which was done to fix some booting related issues).
Not much (none at time of writing) D-I related development is planned. Main focus will remain Calamares.

item.title: Debian Installer (`D-I`)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Quote Kicksecure 17.2.8.1 - Point Release!

Kicksecure 17.2.8.1 - Point Release!
    • Disable debian-installer, needs more testing (Thanks to @ArrayBolt3!)

The reason Debian Installer (D-I) has been disabled is no longer under embargo. The reason is:

  • Debian live-build MitM Proof of Concept · GitHub
  • Debian bug report: live-build should authenticate files it downloads (Thanks to @arraybolt3!)
  • This is incompatible with Kicksecure derivative-maker design goal System Security Level:

    • Always use software signatures verification: Software signatures are consistently verified using OpenPGP, codecrypt, APT, or similar mechanisms.

Debian-Installer

Debian-Installer is a system installer for Debian and its derivatives. It originally appeared in Skolelinux (Debian-Edu) 1.0, released in June 2004, but is now used as the official installation system since Debian 3.1 (Sarge), which was released on June 6, 2005. Debian-Installer consists of two modes: a text mode and a graphical mode. Calamares (software)

Calamares is a free and open-source independent and "distribution-agnostic" system installer for Linux distributions. Calamares is used by NixOS, CachyOS, Garuda Linux, Huayra_GNU/Linux, Manjaro, Netrunner, KaOS, KDE neon, Kubuntu, Lubuntu, Sabayon Linux, Chakra, EndeavourOS, Peppermint OS, Artix Linux, OpenMandriva Lx, Q4OS, the Live medium of Debian, and several less known Linux distributions.
